Topic.Title: Analyst pump

Message.Msg: I can see getting caught up in the hype and momentum, and looking at the holders and thinking this can go up, but to actually do the math on a discounted cash flow basis and think this is undervalued is mind-boggling. The analyst reports I read in detail are laughable and can be sunk by a 1st year finance major. Not only that, but the methodology is entirely different from how that analyst values other companies in the same space. Very simply ... FRAUD .... I hope they are getting paid well by Cap World, FIDO & SAC to pump.

Topic.Title: 90 to 1 looking foward PE in 5 years

Message.Msg: So let me understand this, you now think that AMZN trades on it's fundamentals? You know better than that. It's a Wall Street darling, protected stock that could announce just about anything but bad news about Bezos and a few days later it would be at new highs. Other than sales $'s, their metrics may have never been worse and it is at all time highs. QE, ETFs and who knows what other forces, force this higher. Lesson learned. Generally stay away from this one on the short and puts side and I have traded against many other MOMOs successfully to very successfully. I'm still on the short side here so it's eating into my trading gains for the year and will lower my tax bill. :-) It's a good thing I own a large position in a microcap with incredible fundamentals that is actually trading according to them this year, otherwise my portfolio wouldn't be at post 2000 highs. Buy and hold actually does work sometimes believe it or not.

Message.Title: NASDAQ's Most Undervalued Stock
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) currently $7.89 is starting to breakout big and looks ready to explode. CCUR has only 8.754mm s/o, a market cap of $69.07mm, cash of $22.37mm, no debt, and an enterprise value of $46.7mm. CCUR's enterprise value is only 0.74X revenues of $63.23mm, 6.55X operating cash flow of $7.13mm, and 8.34X free cash flow of $5.6mm. CCUR's EPS was up 175% last quarter and it just raised its dividend by 100% to $0.48 per share for a yield of 6.1%. CCUR is the leader of some of the world's hottest technologies! CCUR leads the video on demand (VOD) delivery business with over 2.4mm streams deployed worldwide and 4 of America's 6 largest cable TV operators as clients. The #2 VOD technology vendor Seachange (SEAC) is currently trading for $11.50 and has an enterprise value of $262.4mm or 1.68X revenues of $156.11mm, 15.05X operating cash flow of $17.43mm, and 19.32X free cash flow of $13.58mm. An enterprise value of 1.68X revenues would value CCUR at $14.69 per share. An enterprise value of 15.05X operating cash flow will value CCUR at $14.81 per share. An enterprise value of 19.32X free cash flow will value CCUR at $14.91 per share. CCUR also has the leading Big Data Analytics software being used by pay-TV operators. CCUR tracks the behavior of 35mm pay-TV subscribers and has processed 15 billion media transactions. Big Data Analytics is the hottest space on Wall Street. Tableau Software (DATA) recently had its IPO at $31 and hit a new 52-week high on Monday of $63 for a gain of 103%. DATA's enterprise value is currently 25X revenues. Another Big Data stock Splunk (SPLK) currently has an enterprise value of 22X revenues. CCUR's enterprise value is currently only 0.74X revenues! CCUR will likely break through its 52-week high of $8.45 in the upcoming days and explode to double digits! CCUR's business is booming as pay-TV operators upgrade to provide multi-screen/TV Everywhere access, Network (cloud based) DVR services, and start-over/look-back services!

Message.Title: So much for Citi's claim on AWS of AMZN
Message.Msg: Shocker: Amazon Web Services cuts prices again — this time on dedicated EC2 instances and by as much as 80 percent in some scenarios. tweet this Amazon Web Services has cut prices on “dedicated” EC2 compute instances by up to 80 percent (!) in some cases. That’s a big price chop even by AWS standards. An instance is a unit of compute power that customers rent by the hour and is a key base unit of AWS or other cloud infrastructure. Increasingly customers are renting compute power in AWS instead of buying their own physical servers. These dedicated instances run on single-tenant hardware that is allocated to one customer account while other instance types run on shared infrastructure. That’s an important implementation option for businesses or government agencies — in financial services, health care, insurance and other regulated entities — that are not supposed to put sensitive workloads on shared hardware. The move comes at a time when Amazon contends with cloud competitors who maintain that they, unlike AWS, offer private cloud capabilities better suited for regulation-constrained industries. And AWS, which leads the league in public cloud infrastructure also faces several rivals — Google Compute Engine, Microsoft Windows Azure, ProfitBricks and CloudSigma — which offer sub-hour incremental pricing on their instances. The stakes are high. Gartner expects the overall market for public cloud services to grow 18.5 percent this year to $130 billion from $111 billion in 2012. All of the aforementioned companies along with Dell, IBM, HP, Red Hat and others are fighting for a piece of the action, although AWS is the market leader. By far. AWS, thus far, has held to a per-hour pricing model but keeps chipping away at those prices. Amazon CTO Werner Vogels has said the company doesn’t hear demand for by-the-minute pricing. Here’s how Amazon sums up the changes on post to its web site: Dedicated Per Region Fee – An 80 percent price reduction from $10 per hour to $2 p

Topic.Title: Analyst pump

Message.Msg: @ 300, the average guy doesn't have money to buy AMZN or many stawks for that matter. The PT game is a moving target game while the bottom line/valuation metrics are declining. Only to justify them using 401k and investment money to pump it up to get the fees. The fees are not refundable if the bet blows up BTW, which always seem to be given time. It has become a giant ponzi scheme at this point and the supply of bag holders is getting short with the FED included. The only reason anything is going up because the smart money need to dump some more.

Topic.Title: 2013: a 1929-1987 style Stock Market Crash starting between now and October ?

Message.Msg: The "good news" from Mr. B could set the stage for the final top.

Topic.Title: 2013: a 1929-1987 style Stock Market Crash starting between now and October ?

Message.Msg: In 1929 and 1987, the market topped out at the end of August. I think the final top in 2013 comes in the next week or two, followed by a volatile roller coaster churning. Once the churning ends, the first break will carry the market down between 10-20%, followed by a slight recovery. The second wave down (probably in Sept-Oct) will see the massive plunge, up to 40-50% off the highs. Come back in October and see how accurate this forcast is.

Topic.Title: 2013: a 1929-1987 style Stock Market Crash starting between now and October ?

Message.Msg: I would advise the purchase of puts and put spreads expiring not earlier than September (October preferable) on stocks across the board. Ladder in, over the month, not all at one time.

Topic.Title: 2013: a 1929-1987 style Stock Market Crash starting between now and October ?

Message.Msg: I hope this forcast doesn't happen, beacuse if it does, it means hardship for many. But parabolic speculative rallies sets the stage severe plunges, almost always. That is the lesson of economic history.

Message.Title: If amazon goes between 325.00-350.00 per share earnings per share.
Message.Msg: Gross sales won't make a difference, earnings will count

Topic.Title: If amazon goes between 325.00-350.00 per share earnings per share.

Message.Msg: Earnings will matter at some point, maybe soon, those who think they don't matter is delusional especially if growth is slowing. In normal cases, slower growth should be accompanied with steady increase in earnings as the company is transitioning from high expansion rates to value creation. Not happening here. They're desperate trying to keep the yoy growth @ 15-20%. This has been the excuse for nearly 20 years of AMZN existence it's not sustainable. It will be great to see this ponzi scheme finally implode.

Topic.Title: 2013: a 1929-1987 style Stock Market Crash starting between now and October ?

Message.Msg: Parabolic rallies require ever increasing bets from the participant to continues. It's fine as long as the players have the resources/confident (FED) to continue. At a certain stage, prices are running so far from reality that certain participants become nervous and started cashing out. Than the rest is history. Charts do not lie if you know how to read it.
